text.0: With simultaneous protests going on around the country, young people in Nigeria have put a demand on the government to #EndSARS and they will not stop until their demand is met. Read here: https://t.co/kaVdTIy3bc #DubawaChecks
text.1: Some Twitter users shared a picture of dead bodies lined side by side, claiming that they were killed during the #EndSARS protest in Ogbomoso.  However, investigations reveal the picture was of victims of bandit attacks in Kaduna. Read here: https://t.co/2R3NEx8KMj #DubawaChecks
text.2: @thesultangrey @thetoolsman @PeoplesCheck1 Yes, we are. Apart from our monitoring efforts, feel free to push any questionable claims you come across our way.
text.3: @thetoolsman Yes we do. We fact check all media. Have a claim for us?
text.4: ICYMI: A WhatsApp message going around that claims that the National Universities Commission (NUC) is giving out loans to start-ups and established business owners is misleading. Read here: https://t.co/HGoPn2TwPu #DubawaChecks #FactCheck
text.5: The viral claim via a screenshot that being an ex-convict is a requirement to join SARS is false. SARS cannot recruit for itself, therefore the recruitment list was made up. Read the fact-check here: https://t.co/9zfBcBM5sX #DubawaCheck #FactCheck #EndSARS
text.6: Two days after President Buhari presented the 2021 Budget Proposal to the National Assembly, former Vice President Atiku Abubakar issued a statement critiquing the Proposal. We fact-checked some claims made in Atiku's statement. Read here: https://t.co/e7zWsTG3P2 #DubawaChecks

user_mentions.name: His Royal Highness ⚡️ | The Sultan Grey ⚡️
